Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of cHuR as a Predictive Marker for Chemotherapy Response in Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either gemcitabine (GEM) or 5-fluorouracil (5-FU) as adjuvant monotherapy.

Participants.evidence: 379 PDA patients from the European Study Group of Pancreatic Cancer-3 trial were included.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either gemcitabine (GEM) or 5-fluorouracil (5-FU) as adjuvant monotherapy.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluated cytoplasmic HuR (cHuR) as a predictive marker for chemotherapy response in resected pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDA) patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was disease-free survival (DFS), measured over a specified timeframe.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either gemcitabine (GEM) or 5-fluorouracil (5-FU) as adjuvant monotherapy.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 379 PDA patients from the European Study Group of Pancreatic Cancer-3 trial were included.

Result_Outcome.evidence: patients with high cHuR expression had significantly greater median DFS with 5-FU compared to GEM (20.1 months, CI: 8.3–36.4 vs 10.9 months, CI: 7.5–14.2; P = 0.04).

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.
